title: Tariff Legal Battle Continues as China, India, Russia Tighten Ties
description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss the legal confusion around President Trump's tariff policy. Bloomberg's Mike McKee and Erik Larson join to discuss. Plus, Peter Atwater of Financial Insyghts weighs in on how the legal limbo impacts relationships with trading partners. Wendy Cutler of the Asia Society Policy Institute joins to discuss China, Russia, and India's tightening ties, and Ken Shea of Bloomberg Intelligence breaks down Kraft Heinz's planned breakup. (Source: Bloomberg)

summary: The "BLOOMBERG BUSINESSWEEK DAILY" features two journalists, Carol Massar and TIM STENOVEC, who are reporting for the magazine BLOOMERG. They discuss the ongoing Tariff Legal Battle between China, India, Russia, and China as countries tighten their ties. They will also discuss U.S. TRADING PARTNERS' losses and the potential impact of the upcoming TARIFF Court LOSSes. argos_summary: The Bloomberg Businessweek Daily episode focuses on the legal uncertainty surrounding President Trump’s tariff policy after an appeals court ruled the tariffs illegal, with potential Supreme Court review. The discussion highlights how the ruling could affect trade relationships, especially with China, Russia, and India, and examines the broader impact on U.S. trade policy and market sentiment. Meanwhile, analysts touch on corporate news such as Kraft Heinz’s planned breakup and broader market movements, underscoring the interconnectedness of policy, trade, and corporate strategy.
